entry.et: Middle English, from Old English *cohhian; akin to Middle High German kūchen to breathe heavily

def.dt: :to expel air from the lungs suddenly with an explosive noise
:to make a noise like that of coughing
:to expel by coughing often used with up cough up mucus
:a condition marked by repeated or frequent coughing
:a lozenge or troche used to relieve coughing
:any of various sweet usually medicated liquids used to relieve coughing
:hand over deliver cough up the money
:to lose possession of (a ball or puck) during a game the quarterback coughed up the ball

:an infectious respiratory disease especially of children caused by a bacterium (Bordetella pertussis) and marked by a convulsive spasmodic cough sometimes followed by a crowing intake of breath called also pertussis
